answer:
Main Answer:
Revolut collects various types of personal data for providing financial services. This data is collected from multiple sources, including third parties and other people, credit reference agencies, financial or credit institutions, official registers and databases, joint account holders, fraud prevention agencies, and partners.

Key Points:
• Credit record and information about late payments
• Identity verification information (including image, facial scan data, and address)
• Information provided during registration or approval of children's accounts
• Records of discussions and phone calls
• Biometric data (facial scan data)
• Financial circumstances information
• Information to protect against fraud and meet legal responsibilities

GDPR References:
• Article 6 - Lawfulness of Processing: Revolut processes personal data based on various legal bases, including consent, legitimate interests, and legal obligations.
• Article 9 - Processing of Special Categories of Personal Data: Biometric data is considered a special category of personal data and is processed under the legitimate interests of Revolut for identity verification and fraud prevention.
• Article 13 - Information to be Provided to the Data Subject: Revolut is required to provide individuals with specific information about the processing of their personal data.
• Article 14 - Information to be Provided to the Data Subject where Personal Data have not been obtained from the Data Subject: Revolut must provide individuals with specific information when collecting their personal data from third parties.
• Article 58 - Specific Rules for Processing Personal Data relating to Criminal Convictions and Offences: Revolut processes personal data related to financial crime and fraud prevention under the substantial public interest and legal obligations.

Main Answer:
Revolut collects several categories of personal data specific to their financial service delivery. Their collection includes identity verification data, transaction histories, location data for card usage, and technical information about service interactions. The system captures financial patterns, payment method details, and currency conversion data during service delivery. Their framework documents specific purposes for each data category, with clear necessity requirements for different service types. The approach includes enhanced data collection for certain higher-risk services based on value or risk assessment.

Key Points:
• Structured collection of financial and identity data
• Purpose-specific information gathering
• Clear documentation of necessity requirements
• Enhanced collection for high-risk services

GDPR Reference: Article 5(1)(c) - Data minimization

answer:
Main Answer:
Under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), customers have several rights regarding their personal data held by Revolut.

Key Points:
- **Right to Data Portability**: If requested, Revolut can provide your personal data in a structured, commonly used, machine-readable format (Article 20 - Right to Data Portability).
- **Right to Withdraw Consent**: You have the right to withdraw your consent for the use of your personal data at any time. You can do this by changing your privacy settings in the Revolut app or by emailing dpo@revolut.com (Article 7 - Right to Withdraw Consent).
- **Right to Object to Processing**: You have the right to object to the processing of your personal data for direct marketing and profiling purposes (Article 21 - Right to Object).
- **Right to Access**: You have the right to request a copy of the contract that governs any data transfers made to countries outside the UK or EEA, if applicable (Article 13 - Information to be Provided and the Right of Access).
- **Exemptions**: As a regulated financial services provider, Revolut may be required to keep certain customer personal data even when you ask for deletion (Article 5(e) - Processing of Personal Data Necessary for Compliance with a Legal Obligation).

Please note that not all rights may be applicable in every situation. If you have any questions or need further clarification, please contact Revolut's Data Protection Officer at dpo@revolut.com.
